John Panzer wrote:
 > ...
> However, I'm a bit unclear on the problem.  PATCH, or any other 
> solution, also needs to be deployed, and servers need to be able to 
> advertise the capability -- e.g., via Allow: -- for them to be really 
> useful.  All of this is an optimization anyway; you don't want clients 
> attempting PATCH on every server and giving up if it bounces off.  So 
> I'm not sure why it's any harder to deploy than any other solution.  Any 

John,

the deployment issue is that there are servers out there that *ignore* 
Range headers in requests. When they do, a client that tried just to 
send a range will have replaced the whole resource -> data loss.

 > WebDAV mailing list archives available for perusal?
